info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 22 at 4:00AM MDT until June 25 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Hot daytime temperatures with afternoon highs 100 to 105 degrees. Morning low temperatures remaining warm in the mid to upper 70s. * WHERE...Central Tularosa Basin in Otero County. * WHEN...Through at least midnight MDT Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heat products will be extended through early next week due to prolonged period of hot temperatures.
info.instruction: A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are possible. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
